Title: Marketing Merchandising
RoleDescription:
Wayfair is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Associate, Marketing Merchandising to join our UK Marketing Merchandising team. This team is responsible for shaping a best-in-class merchandising experience by strategically selecting and presenting products that align with market trends, customer preferences, and business objectives across multiple channels - including TV, onsite, social media, email, and out-of-home (OOH) marketing.
As an Associate, Marketing Merchandising, you will support the development and execution of assortment and merchandising strategies for key promotional and brand campaigns. You will work cross-functionally to ensure seamless execution, leveraging data insights to curate high-impact product selections that enhance customer engagement and drive business performance. This role requires a creative eye, strong analytical skills, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
What Youll Do
Assortment Strategy & Execution

Develop and execute curated product assortments for key promotional and brand campaigns within project timelines
Align merchandising initiatives with business priorities, customer preferences, and seasonal trends.
Address tactical and operational challenges to ensure seamless merchandising execution.
Collaborate with Category Management and Pricing teams to integrate sales insights, optimize product selections, and identify growth opportunities.

Performance Analysis & Optimization

Analyze campaign and product performance to generate insights, refine strategies, and enhance future curated assortments.
Ensure quality assurance for all merchandise assets, maintaining accuracy and recommending improvements as needed.
Conduct post-campaign reviews to identify key learnings and drive continuous improvement.

Market Research & Trend Forecasting

Monitor consumer trends, competitive activity, and industry shifts to refine Wayfairs merchandising strategy.
Utilize data-driven insights to enhance curation tactics and optimize category performance.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Merchandising Initiatives

Assist in developing and executing curated events and cross-functional merchandising initiatives, including event tracking, content management, merchandising curation, and New In strategy.
Collaborate with Marketing, Brand, Creative, Promotions, and Category Management teams to refine Wayfairs merchandising approach.
Ensure merchandising strategies align with business objectives, seasonal trends, and customer insights.

Process Improvement & Operational Efficiency

Optimize merchandising workflows to enhance efficiency and streamline operations.
Implement best practices to improve the speed, accuracy, and effectiveness of marketing merchandising.
Coordinate cross-functional teams to ensure seamless collaboration and stakeholder alignment.

What Youll Need

Bachelors degree in Marketing, Advertising, Brand, Business, Economics, or a related field, with experience in buying / merchandising, e-commerce, or retail.
Ability to translate brand vision, customer insights, and financial objectives into effective product assortments and seamless execution.
Data-driven mindset, with expertise in analyzing large data sets and deriving actionable insights.
Strong aesthetic sense and trend awareness to drive high-quality product curation.
Passion for industry trends, product design, and home decorating is a plus.
Proven project management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, fostering strong cross-functional partnerships.
Proficiency in Excel, Looker, Google BigQuery (GBQ), or similar performance tracking tools is a plus.
Fluency in English

Why Join Us?
This role offers the opportunity to be at the intersection of creative curation and data-driven decision-making. You will play an integral role in shaping Wayfairs promotional and brand merchandising strategy, ensuring our product selections resonate with customers and drive business impact.
If you are passionate about merchandising, analytical problem-solving, and delivering an exceptional customer experience, wed love to hear from you!
Benefits Include: Wayfair Employee Discount, Benefits Hub, Private Medical Care, Dental Care, Gym Membership,  Tuition Reimbursement, 25 Days starting Holiday (with tenure entitlement) + Bank Holidays,  Pension, cycle to work scheme.

Title: User Researcher II
RoleDescription:
This is a hybrid on-site position based out of our Boston, MA office. (Monday/Friday Remote, Tuesday-Thursday in-office each week)
 
Who We Are
Wayfair's Customer Tech team is responsible for designing, building, analyzing, and managing the entire Customer experience on Wayfair's websites and mobile app. This role is for a person that is passionate about users and has a desire to help deliver positive consumer experiences through research.
What Youll Do
As a User Researcher on the Customer Tech team, you will be empowered to plan and run research projects end-to-end, including defining clear problem statements, framing project goals and ingoing research assumptions and questions, scoping and selecting the appropriate methods and tools, supporting in recruitment, running/facilitating research activities, analyzing and synthesizing data, sharing and socializing findings, etc. Ultimately, you will influence and persuade cross-functional leaders and more senior partners to act on your findings.
What You'll Need:

Professional experience - approx. 3+ years of professional experience in research, with at least 2+ years of user research experience specifically
Bachelors degree - in Human Factors, Experimental/Cognitive Psychology, HCI, or related field 
Mixed methods research experience - you will scope and execute on qualitative and/or quantitative research plans, selecting the appropriate methodology to answer key product and research questions
Recruitment experience - you will work closely with Research Operations to define & handle UXR study recruitment needs, logistics, scheduling, and incentives
Analysis and storytelling skills - you will need to clearly synthesize and present UXR insights to key stakeholders with actionable takeaways
Collaboration skills - you will collaborate across functions such as Product Design, Content Strategy, Product Management, Analytics, Engineering and more
Proficiency in research and design tools - such as Qualtrics, Userzoom/Usertesting, Optimal Workshop, Reduct, Full Story, Resonate, Figma and Miro.
Product centric mindset  your research will be focused on the digital CX and helping product and design to discover and deliver on new opportunities 
Design thinking experience - you will likely run and participate in ideation sessions and design sprints. We want to hear your ideas and see you build on others ideas

Title: Senior Analyst, Global Returns & Incidents Team (Supplier Experience)
RoleDescription:
Must be ONSITE in Boston, MA (Monday - Thursday) 
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: F1-OPT, STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN.
The Global Returns & Incidents Supplier Experience team is focused on improving the Wayfair customer and supplier experience while simultaneously reducing post order cost exposure, in the form of incident & return management and prevention. We are experts in incident and return data. We execute on a number of centralized operational strategies in the areas of policies, processes, new programs, and supplier engagement. 
Global Returns & Incidents Team is part of the broader Supply Chain Operations organization. Our mission is to create fair, easy, and predictable policies for our suppliers that incentivize reductions in post order issues for customers. In doing so, we design, execute, and measure policies and experiences in the post-order space to ensure we are continuously improving. Our overall mission: Reduce post-order issues for Wayfair customers while maximizing supplier happiness. 
What Youll Do:
We are looking for analytical, action-oriented, and collaborative individuals that can translate business problems to actionable insights and data driven solutions to influence supplier engagement and ultimately improve the customer experience. Successful individuals in this role excel at both qualitative and quantitative analysis while also being adept at communicating their strategic and actionable business proposals upwards and outwards.

Create analytics reporting to generate actionable insights to reduce returns and incidents 
Stand up KPIs to track progress on initiatives and summarize overtime macro trends in business performance
Manage and partner across multiple stakeholder groups such as supplier account managers, storefront designers, operations experts, and finance teams
Collaborate with Product teams to design and implement supplier reporting in self-service tooling
Be an effective contributor in a team that manages multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment with effective communication and thorough follow through
Problem solve situations; requiring use of data collection and analysis

What Youll Need:

Masters degree in a quantitative field - Degree in Engineering, Supply Chain, Mathematics, Economics or other concentrations with heavy quantitative focus strongly preferred
Expert knowledge of Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets, SQL/GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Critical and quantitative thinking while also showcasing the acumen to selectively put qualitative insights over quantitative data
Team-first attitude with enthusiasm for cross-functional collaboration
Passion for process optimization and transformation - Experience with complex operational, process, and performance improvement projects
High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple, competing priorities simultaneously
An entrepreneurial spirit and mindset; you must be adaptable and comfortable with change

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy:
All Boston-based interns, Co-ops, and corporate employees will be in office in a hybrid capacity. Employees will work in the office on designated days, Monday - Thursday, and work remotely Friday.

Title: Process, Audit and Jump Supervisor
RoleDescription:
Process, Audit, & Jump Supervisor - Global Transportation & Delivery
We are support partners and leaders on the Wayfair Global Supply Chain Transportation and Delivery Enablement Team.  We support our large parcel delivery locations, providing direct feedback & development to our Transportation & Delivery teams through onsite audits and training. We bring extensive process knowledge to our stakeholders and aid in the development of network-wide resources through process, audit, and training  initiatives and building audits to optimize performance and enhance employee engagement. We are culture enthusiasts throughout our entire Supply Chain network.  
We are looking for a proven leader to influence cross-functional teams responsible for development, standard work, and championing the Wayfair culture in our Middle Mile and Home Delivery Operations. The candidate must be a collaborative problem solver, strategic planner, and one who can manage & supervise high performing teams in a fast-paced, rapidly challenging, and fluid environment. 
Schedule:   

Hours for this position are five 8-hour shifts per week.
Monday - Friday 8AM-5PM, with flex to overnight shifts as needed
At times, will need to flex schedule days/times to support operational needs - including working overnight full night shifts, or working an alternate day (weekends).
Travel 75%  required, sometimes with short notice.

Location:

Role Location Options:  

City of Industry, CA
Linden, NJ
Pompano Beach, FL
Manassas, VA
Phoenix, AZ


What You'll Do

Perform regular audits of HDO Warehouses locations across the country as assigned, focusing on 5S standards and process compliance. 
Present audit findings with network leadership and provide feedback based on your onsite observations.
Follow up on previous audits to ensure that action plans have been successfully implemented.
Coordinate, lead, and execute all training functions HDO locations, including new hire orientation, job function training, new process & tech launches, and continuous development.
Lead various training sessions as needed, including but not limited to: New Hire Fundamentals, Powered Industrial Vehicle (PIV) training, Quality & Process (Current & New SOP) Training.
Use operational expertise to flex to support site operations during peak volume periods, and when needed.  Supervise the functions and working of warehouse workers while adhering to the compliance of all legal and safety procedures.
Work effectively with other managers within functional team and support new team members.
Support T&D Enablement, Safety, and Operations by championing training programs, processes, and initiatives; provide upward feedback and share observations with business owners to improve alignment, compliance, quality, and engagement.

What Youll Need

3+ years of experience in Supply Chain Leadership, Change Management OR 4 year degree in relevant field, required
Experience in Operations or Supply Chain preferred
Raymond and/or Crown forklift/powered industrial vehicle certifications preferred.  Willingness to be trained on multiple vehicle types required.
Leadership skills and the ability to make decisions with little or no guidance based on policies or best practices.
Exceptional written and verbal communication to effectively communicate with all stakeholder levels.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
A seek-to-understand mindset and teamwork strategies that will allow you to connect with and influence diverse groups of people, including your training audience and stakeholder network.

Title: Data Scientist III, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Data Scientist III, Customer Technology
Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Wayfair websites generate over 100M clicks from the millions of customers that visit our sites every day to discover and purchase home goods. The Customer Tech Data Science team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems.
The Customer Tech Data Science team aims to unlock & enable high quality Storefront insights and data capabilities at scale, driven by a robust and extensible platform of self-service capabilities across Customer Technology technology resulting in a higher-impact data-driven organization. Our customers are internal Wayfair teams. Specifically all teams and cross-functional partners on Storefront as well as teams who want to use Storefront-produced data to derive insights and take data-driven actions.
As a Data Scientist III for Customer Tech, your goal is to unlock insights and guide the business in the data domain. This includes everything from advising on technical implementation tradeoffs and priorities (e.g. Storefronts near real-time or experimentation data capabilities) to developing broad level strategic direction and vision in our customer data strategy and architecting the future data models to meet our users needs and anticipating impactful use cases. All while maintaining data quality and analytical rigor. To be successful, this role requires a blend of analytical experience, strong technical capability, ability to develop and influence business strategy, and stakeholder management; all applied to drive the quality, impactfulness, and vision of  Wayfairs customer data. 
 
What You'll Do

Define and own the strategic agenda to unlock insights and guide the business
Run open-ended exploratory data analysis to identify new ideas and opportunities
Consult on A/B tests of our latest technology being implemented (e.g. decoupled services, enhanced recommendations algorithms, new features) to ensure effective and accurate data capture for experimentation reporting
Proactively monitor our data models to identify potential issues, determine root causes, and resolve. 
Build new tools that allow us to be more productive and efficient
Work closely and build productive relationships with our product, engineering and machine learning stakeholders.
Proactively identify areas where advanced analytical efforts can produce a strong value add and work them into the road map.
Communicate key insights and recommendations to cross-functional executive leaders across the organization

 
What You'll Need

Bachelors in computer science, engineering, math, statistics, economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
4+ years work experience in a relevant field (in addition to any graduate education).
Analytics or Data Science experience with e-commerce companies is a strong plus.
In-depth experience with SQL (aggregate functions, query optimization, stored procedures, string parsing, Vertica/Hive/Presto/Spark, etc.), required.
In-depth experience with python & python tools (Jupyter notebooks, functions, pandas, sklearn, matplotlib, etc.), required.
Experience with experimental design (A/B tests) and statistical analysis to drive business decision making, highly preferred. 
Knowledge and experience using machine learning algorithms/techniques (decision trees, random forest, deep learning, etc.) within a business context, highly preferred. 
Strong written and verbal communication with a team player, highly collaborative attitude. 
Ability to collaborate and proactively communicate with stakeholders.
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Thrive in a fast-paced environment. 
Strong business acumen, analytical skills, and technical abilities along with problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated success influencing senior level stakeholders on strategic direction based on recommendations backed by in-depth analysis.
Prior experience proactively identifying areas where analytical efforts can produce a strong business value add and setting the analytics roadmap.
Able to manage multiple projects and deliver against aggressive goals.

Title: Strategy & Analytics Manager, EU
RoleDescription:
Job Description
Are you interested in helping shape the future of Wayfairs analytics and support driving insights and visibility across the business? Are you excited about being at the leading edge of Wayfairs commercial strategy, building the approach that will enable Wayfair to succeed both today and in the future?
As a Manager on the NAEURTA (North America & Europe Recipe, Tools, and Analytics) team, you will play a pivotal role in defining and executing cost, assortment and promotion strategies across Wayfair's global supplier base. Reporting to the Head of Global Recipe Performance, this individual drives measurable improvements in key cost-related metrics while enabling scalable supplier engagement and campaign execution in both the US and EU markets.
This is a highly cross-functional role, working closely with Category Management, Supplier Relationship Managers (SRMs), Profit Management, Pricing Algorithms, and Tech & Reporting teams to build tools, processes, and strategies that drive down costs, improve promotional depth, and deliver value to both Wayfair customers and suppliers.
How is this opportunity unique?
Wayfair is a data-driven environment. Candidates with experience using data to drive decision-making are great matches.
We move fast and take risks. If you loved working at a start-up or in another fast-paced, risk-taking environment, youd enjoy working at Wayfair. Be prepared to constantly evolve.
Confidence is key. The Retail Technology & Analytics team has a 360 view across suppliers, supplier-facing business teams, and internal Wayfair technology and product teams. Youll need to be able to gain buy-in from senior leaders and cross-functional teams to accomplish your goals.
Our business is in high-growth stage and so is our team. Were looking for team members who are ready and eager to get their hands dirty and drive results right away.
What You'll Do

Own and evolve Wayfairs global cost and promotional strategy, with a focus on driving competitiveness in everyday pricing and major promotional events (e.g., Way Day, Cyber Week).
Lead NA & EU-wide cost strategy and sprints , driving aggressive base cost negotiations through scalable comms, bulk recommendations, and talk tracks.
Partner with cross-functional teams and stakeholders  (Global Partner support team, Profit Management, engineering) to design and enhance tools  to support CM and supplier decision-making. (e.g Negotiation Hub, Cost Stack,etc)
Align North America and European approaches for campaigns, ensuring localization without sacrificing scalability.
Improve product cost level and drive deep promotional cost reduction for major events through supplier marketing levers, appcues, and discount strategy coordination.
Build and deliver training to Category Managers on new cost tools, negotiation strategies, and best practices.
Lead the roadmap for tech changes related to cost management, including B2B promotions, cost end date functionality, and base cost migration from superrooms.
Monitor adoption and impact of new tools and strategies, and provide ongoing reporting and feedback to senior stakeholders.

What You'll Need

Strong quantitative skills: ability to develop analytical methodologies and assumptions, use data software to conduct analyses, vet and pressure-test data, and synthesize findings
Strong communication skills: ability to succinctly summarize and tailor your communication style to your audience (e.g., senior business stakeholders versus technical product teams). 
Skilled in cross-functional program management, with experience working in a global or matrixed organization.
Strong problem-solving skills: ability to dissect and determine root causes, and vet / prioritize potential solutions (near- and long-term)
Strong prioritization skills: consistent nose for value, prioritizing potential projects / features based on impact to the business
Ability to learn and act quickly, making decisions and drawing conclusions in the face of ambiguity
Strategic thinker with deep experience in pricing, vendor negotiations, and promotional effectiveness.
Experience in working with complex tooling ecosystems and leading roadmap development with technical teams.
Experience managing others 
Advanced Excel and familiarity with SQL, Looker, or similar BI tools. 
5 -8  years experience in a strategy, pricing, merchandising, or consulting role.
Strong understanding of B2B/B2C retail economics and digital marketplace dynamics.

The newly launched Wayfair Rewards program is an essential part of this mission, offering customers meaningful benefits that provide exceptional value and an enhanced shopping experience. The loyalty team is responsible for developing, marketing, and administering the benefits of Wayfair Rewards in ways that profitably stimulate repeat purchasing, increase share-of-wallet, and drive brand preference in home.

Title: Full Time Associate, Retail Logistics & Inventory
RoleDescription:
Full Time Associate, Logistics & Inventory
Location: 3232 Lake Ave Suite 1, Wilmette, IL 60091
Compensation for this role starts at $17/hour.
Overview:As a Logistics & Inventory Ops Associate, you'll be a key player in ensuring smooth inventory flow and back-of-house operations for Wayfair's Physical Retail team. Your responsibilities will include unloading shipments, managing inventory movement, and maintaining product accuracy to create a seamless shopping experience for customers. This role requires attention to detail, comfort with warehouse environments, and the ability to handle heavy merchandise efficiently. The ideal candidate is highly organized, thrives in a fast-paced setting, and is eager to contribute to operational excellence.
What Does a Logistics & Inventory Associate Do?

Demonstrates Reliability: Attendance and commitment to being present and on time for your full shift each day is crucial. This ensures were prepared to support our customers when they need us most. For unexpected events or issues, we require our team members to be proactive in their communications and planning whenever possible.
Receive and Process Shipments: Unload and receive inbound furniture and other products, including manually moving large, heavy goods. Ensure inventory is accurately processed and documented.
Customer Engagement: You will be responsible for owning and delivering a positive customer experience for curbside transitions, carry-out, pickups, and returns.
Ensure Inventory Accuracy: Use scanning technology to record carton-level details, including product condition, quantity, and location within the store.
Monitor Order Management Systems: Track in-store and online orders processed through back-of-house operations to ensure timely fulfillment.
Manage Inventory Movement: Pick, stage, and move products from storage to the sales floor while maintaining proper organization and placement.
Support Operational Excellence: Collaborate with store teams to resolve inventory discrepancies, maintain accurate stock levels, and uphold Wayfairs commitment to efficiency.
Adhere to Safety Standards: Follow safety guidelines for lifting, equipment use, and warehouse operations to create a secure work environment.

What are the Job Requirements?

Education: High School Diploma or equivalent is required.
Retail or Warehouse Experience: At least 6+ months of experience working in a retail backroom, warehouse, distribution, or logistics environment is preferred.
Physical Capability: Ability to lift up to 50 lbs unassisted and move items 150 lbs+ with equipment or a team lift. Comfortable working in a warehouse/back-of-house environment for the majority of the shift.
Technical Skills: Familiarity with scanning technology and order management systems is preferred.
Adaptability & Problem-Solving: Ability to adjust to evolving processes and take initiative in troubleshooting inventory or logistics challenges.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

Physical Demands

Frequent movement including standing, stooping, kneeling, crouching
Occasional lifting, carrying, pushing, and pulling up to 50 lbs
Frequent repetitive motions and coordination
Constant handling, grasping, and communication (talking/hearing)
Ability to ascend/descend stairs and balance

Working Environment

Some exposure to cold, heat, and humidity
Occasional noise and vibrations
Minimal hazards and seasonal temperature changes

Title: Software Engineer II, Supply Chain Retail Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently. 
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Throughout this customer journey, we are responsible for maintaining an accurate representation of our dynamic supply chain, determining how different products will fit into boxes, predicting how these boxes will flow through warehouses and trucks, and ultimately surfacing the information our customers need to inform their decision and the details our suppliers and carriers require to successfully execute on the promises made to our customers. We do all of this in milliseconds, thousands of times per second.
What Youll Do:

Partner with your business stakeholders to provide them with transparency, data, and resources to make informed decisions.
Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with.
Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.

We Are a Match Because You Have:

2-4 years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
Track-record of technical leadership for teams following software development best practices (e.g. SOLID, TDD, GRASP, YAGNI, etc).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Experience building web services with Java and Springboot.
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc).
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Aerospike, Redis.
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc).

Title: Software Engineer III, Security Operations Center
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair is the online leader for home furnishings and decor. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 8 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares and more. 
Wayfair operates a growing Security Operations Center and were looking for a talented Security Engineer to join and help grow our team. Our Security Operations team is tasked with monitoring and protecting Wayfair from an ever growing number of security risks, and finding new and creative ways to do so. We have a strong focus on engineering and innovation, and are seeking individuals who love to find new problems and hate fixing the same problem twice.
What Youll Need

6+ years experience working in cyber security operations
Thorough understanding of the threat landscape, the latest security trends, attack vectors for corporate and cloud environments, and how build detection and response tooling to identify and respond to malicious actors
Experience with building and scaling SOAR/SIEM technologies
Experience with incident detection and remediation
Strong working knowledge of threat vectors, vulnerabilities, and what anomalies to look for
Strong working knowledge of Linux and/or Windows logs & indicators
Python experience to build and automate tooling
Experience writing SIEM logging parsing rules
Hands-on experience with incident response and monitoring tools, such as SIEM, EDR, cloud monitoring, etc.
Strong communication skills, especially the ability to communicate security risks in business rather than purely engineering
Strong understanding of cyber security best practices and frameworks such as NIST, MITRE, ATT&CK Framework, and OWASP Top 10

What Youll Do

In this role you will work closely with the cyber security organization to build monitoring and response tooling and processes to reduce our mean-time-to-detect and remediate to keep up with threat actors changing tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
Logging - Get all security relevant cloud, infrastructure and application logs parsed, and  into our SIEM
Detection - Setup detection and prevention rules and policies, PoC and deploy tools that help with detection, tune/audit deployed rules/policies in security tools on true and false positives, setting up a detection framework
Response - Build plan and procedures for Incident Response, create playbooks to be followed, automate response, develop/deploy malware analysis tools and techniques, forensic tools and techniques to capture evidence/malware, PoC and deploy tools that help with response, integrate with customer service teams and engineering teams etc.
Build security alerts & dashboards in various incident response tools. Monitor for suspicious activities/alerts in the cloud/infrastructure/application from various sources such as internal reports from employees as well as external reports such as customers/social media, vendors, partners, bug bounty programs etc., deployed/integrated security tools, data visualization tools etc.
Support tooling to help analyze suspicious activities/alerts including malware analysis and forensics
Build and maintain security infrastructure tooling that supports continuous SOC operations and vulnerability management 
As needed, support the response to security alerts and incidents, and take appropriate action to remediate and resolve

Reporting to the Department Manager, youll lead key initiatives that optimize inventory accuracy, streamline logistics operations, and enhance overall store efficiency. Technical Proficiency: Experience with Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel) or Google Suite (especially Sheets). Familiarity with inventory management systems, order management tools, and scan technology preferred.

Communicate with cross-functional leadership
Work in close collaboration with Network Planning, Field Industrial Engineering, Process Definition and Standards Excellence to enable performance management improvements

2+ years relevant experience in supply chain
Excellent communication skills - Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.

Preferred Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent

The Search and Recommendations Machine Learning (ML) team is at Wayfair is at the forefront of designing and implementing algorithms that define our global search experience. Collaborate cross-functionally: Partner with product managers, engineers, and data scientists to align recommendation strategies with business objectives and user needs.
